intro: Elettariopsis surculosa, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in mountainous ecosystems.
